document_data.name: Allspice
document_data.mainbody: '''Allspice''', also called '''pimento''' or '''everry''', was an expensive [[spices|spice]] produced by a berry-bearing bush.
document_data.Availability:
In the [[Cormyr]]ean city of [[Gladehap]], [[Wyrmkindler Sausage Works]] used one thruppinch of allspice berries per {{SI|4|lb|k|long=yes}} of [[stag]] meat in preparation for their ever-popular [[stag sausage]]s.

Elves of the ancient city of [[Myth Drannor]] in the forest of [[Cormanthor]] were quite fond of allspice-seasoned [[pumpkin soup]]. A single whiff of the [[soup]] evoked memories of a legend about [[Aerdrie Faenya]], which told of her transforming the heads of slain [[orc]]s into [[pumpkin]]s. The story symbolized elves using orcs' heads more effectively than they ever did themselves.

Bakers of the wizardly nation of [[Halruaa]] used [[sugar]], [[cardamom]], [[mace (spice)|mace]], and allspice mixture to dust freshly fried sweet buns and [[hangman's noose]]s.

[[Dwarves]] of the [[Northkingdom]] used allspice to prepare sweet, savory, and spicy [[Tide-Me-Overs]].

Allspice, or pimento, was sold across the Realms via ''[[Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue]]'', priced at 40 [[gold]] pieces per {{SI|1|oz.|long=yes}}.

On the [[Malatran Plateau]] in [[Kara-Tur]], allspice was used as a pickling spice, together with [[mustard]] seeds, [[black peppercorn]]s, [[red chiles]], [[clove]]s, [[allspice]], [[coriander]], [[ginger]], and [[mace (spice)|mace]].{{Cite organized play/LJ/A Gathering of Heroes Interactive}}
document_data.Usages: Allspice berries could be used to create [[enchanted]] [[oil]] that could improve one's strength.{{Cite dragon/33/Bazaar of the Bizarre: Magical Oils|47}} A vial of such oil could cost up to 750 [[gp]].
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1372}}, [[Gravia's hot apple cider]], prepared by [[Gravia Maxillian]] of [[Daggerford]]'s farmlands, called for two allspice berries per pot. Secretly a [[werewolf]], Gravia drugged her [[cider]] with [[Zakhara]]n [[knockout drops]] to capture unwitting travelers to be hunted by her bloodthirsty family.
